info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 23 at 8:14PM CDT until March 23 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN KNOX AND NORTHWESTERN BAYLOR COUNTIES... At 814 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles south of Vera, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Tennis ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Seymour, Red Springs, Lake Kemp, Mabelle, Vera, Rhineland and Bomarton. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
